channel.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
channel.description:
This Model Was inspired by the Champion Singed off League of legends.
Well since i started to continue the work on Singed armour pieces, i changed the title to Show the edit.
This was my Reference Image
[img]http://www.scenicreflections.com/ithumbs/Singed_Mad_Chemist_Wallpaper_a1yq0.jpg[/img]
And heres what i made.. i made this model Simply because i love Singed XD. and really i just got bored :/ Hope you enjoy.. (please note.. The spheres in the Shield are only there for render.. if i was to add this into a game.. i would just add them in the texturing. but as i cant texture. YOU GET GREYNESS!) i also added in his Chemical adhesive bottle just for renders
[b]UPDATE[/b]
Rendered with colour. Still to add Details into the textures. but base is done.. Also (i redid the shield so you could say its a v2)
Updated Render: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/LFNgg.png[/img]
Render: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/hxtU9.png[/img]
Wireframe: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/SPYl1.png[/img]
Updated Wireframe: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/jZQlz.png[/img]
and just a normal shot of the shield: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ELue7.png[/img]
Normal Shot With Wireframe: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/PU9rS.png[/img]
Heres and Image of a WIP Shoulder Pads and Armour peice for Singed [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/G9NtP.png[/img]
the shoulders and Armour plate are rendered with a Turbo smooth Causing High polys, When i finish the rendering look i shall Post up a wireframe of it without the turbo smooth

item.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

amy_webb:

When you model you should try keep it all 1 primative, or alteast 1 model (so that they’re all joined), it’s a very challanging thing but if you succeed you have some skills! Just gotta make sure your wireframe looks awesome when you do this, but anyways good job!

Really depends on what you’re modelling, in this case I’d have definitely used floating geometry for the spikes too.

Looks good, nice to see some max users, just keep that geometry flowing and you’ll be fine, also I think a plain clay render would look better than those dark ‘glowing’ renders, use mental ray or vray if available.

The chest armour looks good, but a little too high poly if you ask me, just by looking at it I’d say it’s <10,000, which is unnecessary for something so simple. But keep at it, it looks good!

Read full topic

item.description:
@Strangle wrote:

Updated Again. Added in Chest plate PS please note, I do know about the Funny faces on the shoulder pads. There still to be fixed… Started on the shield again so its not a big worry right now… Its just N-Gons (told you i hate them, see what it does -.-’)

item.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

The Wanderer:

Why not add floating geometry? Saves you some unnecessary polygons.

Perfect example in this case. I just couldn’t figure out why you had them, but now I see. Looking good so far!

Read full topic

item.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
item.dc:creator: @Strangle Strangle
item.description:
@Strangle wrote:

if your talking about these cuts

8nFVW.png435×597

, then yes… i probably have too many, but! the reason i have these cuts all the way down the shield is to stop N-gons appearing. Which can be Disastrous on occasions. So why not just avoid them at all times. It may add a few more polys but its better off gaining 5-10 more faces, then have something that you would have a hard time trying to get into any game engine… now because i only made this for rendering yeah i could have removed them but meh. and the cut furthest on the left is there to bend the shield in its ) type shape.

the main reason i have these cuts is to have the option to lift up the Leather straps seen here.

now yes i understand the top 1 looks abit funny. but note that the top of the tome stone thing is rounded… so i tried to make it conform with the shape of the tome…

Therefore thats the reason why those cuts are there… Hope that explains something…

Read full topic

item.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

There are, is it 9, cuts down the middle adding unneeded faces. I’m not sure if th lines are just showing through from the other side but you only need 3. The amount of faces on your spikes, you dont need that many. I know it makes it look smooth but even then there are ways around the roughness of less poly. Also under the middle piece of metal there are faces which could have been hidden. It could just be me, but i think if you look at your model and try lower the poly you could see where the extra faces are. This probably isn’t for anything, just made it for the hell of it but if thats so then why doesn’t the rest of the shield have as many faces af the spikes?

Read full topic

item.title: Singed Armour *UPDATED V2*
item.dc:creator: @Strangle Strangle
item.description:
@Strangle wrote:

The Wanderer:

Why is there so many loopcuts in the center of the shield?

uhh where? if you mean the 1s going down, i had to alter the Leather straps to wrap around the tome looking though, And i hate N-gons. so i Make a cut around the whole shield to make it all quads, and same for most Cuts you see. I try to avoid N-gons and amy… Wanna point out the unneeded faces…

Read full topic
